page.title: 08RUISLIP TRANSPORT EMPLOYMENT
page.content: There are 4 underground stations Ruislip, Ruislip Manor and Eastcote on the Piccadilly and Metropolitan lines and,on the Central line, West Ruislip which is a British Rail interchange. There are several London Transport buses and Elmtree an independent firm. We did a survey which transport was used to get to work. 80/137 or 58% went by car. 24/137 or 18% went by train 7/137 or 5% went by bus and the remaining 26 or 19% walked. This ties up with a survey of where people worked with 75% commuting to work. Many of the commuters interviewed on Eastcote Station held professional jobs. A more general survey found 97/272 people or 36% worked in offices 35/272 or 13% in factories 23/272 or 8% worked in shops. Unemployment is low with people moving here for work, but the cost can be prohibitive.
